Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
  Inventory

public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object

an Inventory class that manages items for the player including sorting and looting

Version:
(0.1_3)
Author:
(DeusBlu)

Constructor Summary
Inventory()
          Constructor for objects of class Inventory
Inventory(int size)
          for creating larger inventory items that can be used to store items for monster loot tables and rooms for items dropped on the floor can
 
Method Summary
 int bagSpace()
          this method checks the free space in the bag and returns the spaces as an int
 Item getItem(int spot)
          querries the inventory for the item at its position and returns the item at that location else returns null
 int length()
          returns the total size of your backpack
 boolean lootItem(Item item)
          loots an item into your inventory
 Item removeItem(int spot)
          removes an item from the bag and returns it, returns null if no item found
 void showBag()
          displays the contents of your bag
 void showBagItem(int spot)
          shows the details of the item at requested bag index
 void sort()
          Sorts the inventory to be the same order as set by Item.ITEMTYPE
 boolean transfer(int spot, Inventory from)
          takes an item from one inventory and transfers it to this inventory based on its location in the originating inventory and returns true if it was able to be moved
 
Methods inherited from class
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
